text: Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan (, October 13, 1948 â€“ August 16, 1997), was a Pakistani musician. He was a singer of qawwali, the devotional music of the Sufis. In 2006, Time magazine included him in their list of "Asian Heroes'. Traditionally, qawwali is a performing art which is passed down with in the family. Nusrat's family has been performing qawwali for the last 600 years. Among other honorary titles given to him, Nusrat was called Shahenshah-e- Qawwali, meaning The Emperor of Qawwali. == Other websites == * Category:1948 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Punjabi people Category:Pakistani singers Category:Bollywood playback singers
title: Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan
